replies.body: Burning Tides was the best event up till now. Foundations did a great job, they didn't delete the old lore, but built upon it. Can't wait for the next event.
I actually had a lot more fun with Ascension.

> [{quoted}](name=Ttubkcid90,realm=NA,application-id=Ag8jgd8Q,discussion-id=EAuBjsmE,comment-id=00110000,timestamp=2015-08-26T19:30:37.610+0000)
>
> I actually had a lot more fun with Ascension.

Ascension is my favorite game mode, but the event around it felt flat. Burning Tides had the full package: Black Market Brawlers game mode, a new ARAM map, lore progression, character development for several characters, cool Bilgewater themed skins and an awesome present for Gangplank enthusiasts. The Shurima event was mostly a retcon of previous lore with an awesome game mode.

I definitely agree, even though my computer was busted for the Burning Tides event so I only got to two like two or three games at a friends house. Like, those maybe two hours I spent in it made me feel like I was fully immersed, much more so than any prior event that I was able to spend every day in.

Ascension was - In my opinion the best featured game mode i've played since I began LoL (excluding URF because there no chance of anything being better than it). However, URF had no actual Lore event surrounding it. But Ascension was the best lore-related game mode to exist within LoL. BmB wasn't even very fun except for the fancy minions and some interesting items.  It had such a unique play style, and I enjoyed the fact that they actually made me WANT to play Crystal Scar. You also get to fight freaking Xerath. I mean hes basically the equivalent of Baron in Ascension and being ascended just feels so great. But I rest my case stating that ascension is better than BmB.
I disliked Ascension if only because it marked when Riot started half-assing the lore pages on champions D:

Majority of the Lore is still pretty good. _Riot_'s decided to put the full lore on the **website**, and only part of it on the champions tab in the client. So _Riot_ isn't half-assing the lore, they're making it so no one has a **reason **to read it!
remember ramus' lore around this time? it's basicly just 4 sentences stating that they know nothing of the champ.
DEAR GOD IS THIS TRUE (CHECKS FOR 3 MINS) OH GO IT IS!?
Thanks! We've had a lot of fun fleshing out Bilgewater, and it was great to see it all realized through the event. Glad you are liking this direction! :)
dudes i feel sorry for{{champion:83}}  he's so underused. could u plz update him

You heard it here first! A brand-spankin' new event! 

Yorick: Rise of the Undertaker!

Upcoming Shadow Isles event where Yorick gets Gangplank'd and Twisted Treeline gets Burning Bridge'd. Too bad they didn't hold off the Mordekaiser update and Karthus VU for this. Also Eve gets a new splash and an actual lore.
Karthus VU was over a year ago, they couldn't hold it off that long
You are so right yorick is misunderstood can you make him free next week riot
{{champion:154}} {{champion:266}} are under used too...

As a {{champion:154}} main I can assure you that he is a very strong pick; **Especially** after the update since it buffed his engage range and buffed {{item:3083}} which was already one of my favorite items on him. I use scaling health seals and rush {{item:3709}} and {{item:3083}} first for all around defense. I always hit 3k health by the time I buy {{item:3083}} so the passive kicks in off the bat and makes {{champion:154}} a re-engaging tank machine. I suggest you try him if your into tanky junglers.

"Squid'o'nine"

10/10 would get lashed
I've seen enough hentai....
I want to go to bilgewater so badly! I will do anything to get there!

In other news, Rose Deci has disappeared and is presumed dead after saying something that meant nothing to modern ears, but was a vicious insult to the pirates, murderers, cutthroats, scum, and villainy that live in Bilgewater. Rose Deci was challenged to a duel and died shortly thereafter.
Do you have nothing better to be doing right now? XD

The way they word this makes it sound like a League of Legends MMORPG would be a great idea, like you play as a champ and you get to go through their backstory and stuff and  it would just be awesome. I know that it would never happen but just a thought {{item:3073}} {{item:3070}} {{item:3073}}

You know i am just waiting for you guys to make an art book full of concept pieces like this for bligewater howling abyss and the new map. Also some concept work of champs are cool too. Not like i don't appreciate these post but i would rather it in printed form
Can we be able to switch the bilgewater music back it was amazing.

my idea, is that bilge water was once a spot not far off the coast where ships and outcasts met in open waters to discuss illegal activity's, trade and whatnot, with a lame slogan it would be like, as the tide moves, so does Bilge water. initially it was a single ship named the S.S Bilge water, where renegades and consorts could board with parley, and use it as a sort of conference center with no specific traceable location. Over time it became a floating city with mini shops and services floating along beside bilge water. but when the wars where in progress and the world was being ripped apart, massive stalagmites and columns of rock protruded from the oceans disrupting a particularly large gathering of ships around bilge water (they could be planning to take over noxus or piltover treasury or something) and in there attempts to flee, the escaping ships sealed there fate, getting stuck on top of the ever rising pillars, when the mist had settled, few where left, but miraculously nearly every ship was nestled atop a perch of granite, and the S.S bilge water had finally dropped its anchor for the first time. It was time to start building.

Thank you, someone who actually tried to avoid the pirate cliche. Next step is to make an actual lore for the new champions, like bard or rek'sai. "They are just random people who have magical abilities or are strong so they joined then LoL and god knows how they did it"
Hear that, Riot?  WE WANT LORE.  We like lore.  MOAR LORE.

heck even {{champion:33}} has better lore than those 2...
"rammus woke up to some earthquake in some place, he waddled around and found some armor. poof he's in the LoL" (as far as i know anyway, i didn't proof it.)
Those coffin/anchor things are so dope.
I agree, they are badass. But how come sharks, warfrats, and other scavengers don't just bust in the boxes and eat them? did I miss that? sounds like a buccaneer burial buffet {{item:3611}}
I enjoyed Butcher's bridge so much. The graphical update and the imagery was a very fresh change from the howling abyss... I was hoping that update would have stayed, so beautiful it was.
